result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan Edward Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan Edward Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan Edward Anderson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Attorneys to determine sentence credit within 10 days.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Balance of $163.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF158.
Balance of $80.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF158.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Maintain any mental health treatment.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Costs converted into a civil judgment.
DNA surcharge.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Bryan Edward Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 8:32. Includes 15CT67, 14CM17, 15CF158. ADA Kelly updates the court and filed an amended information. Atty. Caton agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 15CT67, Ct. 3 in 14CM17, amended Ct. 1  in 15CF158 to misdemeanor possession of THC. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CT67, Ct. 3 in 14CM17, amended Ct. 1  in 15CF158 to misdemeanor possession of THC.On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1,2 in 14CM17 and Ct 2,3  in 15CF158. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Court orders a transcript of DE statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H on 15CF158,15CT67, 14CM17
In 15CF158 2 years probation. 
Conditions:
- Costs
   Apply bond on file. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through
- 50 hours of communtiy service per year of probation. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Maintain any mental health treatment. 
- DE not ot operate a MV without a valid DL. 
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing.

In 15CT67 
2 years probation concurrent to 15CF158
-Costs

In 14CM17 
2 years probation concurrent to 15CF158 and 15CT67
- Costs

*Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
DE is elligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation. 
Atty's to determine sentence credit within 10 days. 

Bonds remain in form and amount until DE reports to probation. 
Court authorizes DE release.
